questions.text: What was the name of the villain that appeared in the beginning of "Incredibles 2"?
questions.explanation:
Underminer.

	The Underminer appeared in the last few seconds of "The Incredibles" and the rest of the story played out in "Incredibles 2". The Underminer used an underground machine to dig through the ground and get into a bank vault to steal money. Mr. Incredible and his family stopped the machine from doing any further damage to City Hall, but the Underminer escaped with the money.

questions.text: After seeing Violet in her super hero costume, Mr. Dicker had to erase the memory of her from what teenager's mind?
questions.explanation:
Tony Rydinger.

	Mr Dicker, the handler for the Incredibles, erased Violet from Tony Rydinger's mind. Violet's father didn't realize that Tony and Violet had set up a date. Because Mr. Dicker erased all Tony's memories of Violet, Tony didn't know he had set up a date with Violet.

questions.text: Bob Odenkirk was the voice of Winston Deavor who gave the Incredibles a way to practice their super hero craft. What was the name of Winston's sister who designed the gadgets for Elastigirl?
questions.explanation:
Evelyn.

	Evelyn Deavor was voiced by Catherine Keener. Evelyn was the designer for Devtech, a telecommunication company who gave Elastigirl a way to be a super hero after the protection program had been shut down and Mr. Dicker had been reassigned.

questions.text: When the Parr family moved into their new home, Dash did a quick sweep of the house. Did he say the house had a pool?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Since Elastigirl would be working for Winston Deavor, he gave the Parr family a new home. Dash did a quick sweep of the house and told the others it had a huge backyard and a pool. The living room also had controls for the floor to open up to a pool area.

questions.text: What subject was Dash having problems with in school that he needed help from his dad?
questions.explanation:
Math.

	After settling Jack-Jack in his crib, Bob sat down to watch TV. When Dash asked for help with his math homework, Bob sat down at the dining room table to help him. Dash was studying new math and Bob didn't understand how math could change.

questions.text: After saving a runaway monorail train from crashing, who did Elastigirl learn was the villain that caused the problem?
questions.explanation:
Screenslaver.

	After saving a runaway monorail train from crashing, Elastigirl found out it was caused by a new villain called Screenslaver. The Screenslaver used hypnosis through screens or in glasses to control the minds of people.

questions.text: How many times did Jack-Jack get out of bed after Bob read to him and put him in his crib?
questions.explanation:
Two times.

	The first time Bob gave Jack-Jack a bottle, read him a story and put him in his crib. While Bob was helping Dash with his homework, he heard the TV playing in the living room. Jack-Jack was sitting on the couch with the remote control watching a TV show. Jack-Jack offered Bob the remote control when Bob walked into the living room to see what was happening. When Bob put Jack-Jack to bed the second time, Bob did everything again, but this time put a table and books on top of the crib.

questions.text: While in the living room with his dad, what animal did Jack-Jack see out the glass door?
questions.explanation:
Raccoon.

	Instead of putting Jack-Jack to bed, Bob let him stay in the living room. Bob had fallen asleep on the couch so Jack-Jack was watching TV when he saw the raccoon through the glass door.

questions.text: What did the animal do that caused Jack-Jack to attack him outside?
questions.correct: The animal looked like the robber on Jack-Jack's movie
options: The animal was hurt and needed help.
The animal was trying to get Jack-Jack's attention.
The animal was trying to get inside the house.
questions.explanation:
The animal looked like the robber on Jack-Jack's movie.

	The raccoon looked like the robber in Jack-Jack's movie. At first, Jack-Jack ignored him and continued watching his show, but the raccoon made so much noise that an angry Jack-Jack used his power to attack the raccoon. Jack-Jack and the raccoon were brawling when Bob pulled Jack-Jack off of the raccoon and the raccoon ran away.

questions.text: What was the first power Jack-Jack used to leave the house by himself?
options: Grew tall so he could open the glass door
Used rays to shoot through the glass door
Turned himself into a rage monster and kicked the glass door down
questions.explanation:
Walked through glass.

	Jack-Jack used his powers to walk through the glass door. After that, he attacked the raccoon with the chicken leg the raccoon had gotten from the trash can and made the trash can lid go back onto the trash can. He also used his rays on the raccoon as well as turning into multiples and a ball of fire. Jack-Jack also had his mother's elasticity power.

questions.text: After catching the fake Screenslaver, what did Elastigirl find out was his profession?
questions.explanation:
Pizza delivery driver.

	Elastigirl caught a fake Screenslaver in an apartment set up with equipment and blueprints, but after Elastigirl removed his disguise the man didn't know where he was or what he had done. He blamed the police for setting him up.

questions.text: The Deavor's introduced Elastigirl to other super heroes that had come out of hiding. She met a female super hero named Void. What did Void say her real name was?
questions.explanation:
Karen.

	Elastigirl met several super heroes that had come out of hiding to meet her. The first person to introduce themselves was a female super hero who called herself Void. While introducing herself to Elastigirl, Void used her real name to calm herself.

questions.text: Where did Bob take the kids to eat when he found out Violet's crush worked there?
questions.explanation:
Happy Platter.

	After Dicker told Bob about the Happy Platter that was owned by Tony's parents, Bob took the kids there for dinner where Tony also worked part-time. When Violet saw Tony waiting on them, she blew water out of her nose and was so embarrassed that she left the table.

questions.text: While at a party thrown by the Deavors, who did Elastigirl realize was the actual Screenslaver?
questions.explanation:
Evelyn Deavor.

	Evelyn trapped Elastigirl in the hypnotic goggles just as Elastigirl was figuring out who the Screenslaver really was. Evelyn tricked Bob into coming to meet her and Elastigirl so that he could be hypnotized as well. The kids were the only super heroes not hypnotized by Evelyn.

questions.text: At the end of the movie, the Parrs picked up Violet's crush for a movie. What stopped them from all going to the movie?
questions.explanation:
Police chase.

	The Parrs picked up Tony at his house for the movie "Dementia 113". When a police chase passed by them, Violet left Tony at the movie theater and went with her family to be super heroes.
